item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, September 8, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. FBI recommends using an ad blocker (31 points | 1 comment)
2. Core: New way to develop video games (140 points | 94 comments)
3. "Unstripping" binaries: Restoring debugging information in GDB with Pwndbg (76 points | 10 comments)
4. Unconventional Case Study of Neoadjuvant Oncolytic Virotherapy for Breast Cancer (67 points | 25 comments)
5. Business Moleskine Mania: How a Notebook Conquered the Digital Era (61 points | 38 comments)
6. alphaXiv: Open research discussion on top of arXiv (425 points | 142 comments)
7. Creating a Git Commit: The Hard Way (40 points | 2 comments)
8. Serving AI from the Basement – 192GB of VRAM Setup (187 points | 131 comments)
9. LibrePythonista allows running IPython code in a LibreOffice spreadsheet (108 points | 22 comments)
10. White House asks agencies to step up internet routing security efforts (69 points | 19 comments)
11. LuaJIT PR: Add Support for RISC-V 64 (96 points | 32 comments)
12. The Lurker's Guide to Babylon5 (59 points | 14 comments)
13. The Story Behind Fenster (8 points | discuss)
14. Infisical (YC W23) Is Hiring a Developer Who Love Writing ( | hide)
15. Telum II at Hot Chips 2024: Mainframe with a Unique Caching Strategy (13 points | 4 comments)
16. How a Customer Got Trapped in Ambetter's Ghost Network (38 points | 3 comments)
17. The muscular imagination of Iain M. Banks: a future you might want (159 points | 159 comments)
18. Deadline looms: Google Workspace mandates OAuth by September 30 (21 points | 9 comments)
19. Graphics Tricks from Boomers (81 points | 9 comments)
20. PC Floppy Copy Protection: Softguard Superlok (82 points | 21 comments)
21. How a 16th Century Explorer's Sailing Ship Works (130 points | 39 comments)
22. Snapshottable Stores (55 points | 4 comments)
23. Asking the wrong questions (2017) (177 points | 105 comments)
24. WebP: The WebPage Compression Format (490 points | 179 comments)
25. A day in the life of the fastest supercomputer (49 points | 25 comments)
26. Cracking an old ZIP file to help open source the ANC's "Vula" secret crypto code (290 points | 29 comments)
27. Using rsync to create a limited ability to write remote files (30 points | 5 comments)
28. Microui+fenster=Small GUI (185 points | 22 comments)
29. Dogs can remember names of toys years after not seeing them, study shows (303 points | 171 comments)
30. CitizenDJ – Make music using free audio and video from the Library of Congress (244 points | 18 comments)
